Background Upper extremity complication common follow stroke . Individuals sustain stroke often left residual motor deficit upper limb . These deficit restrict functional use limb everyday activity result increase dependen cy upon others engage task . Objectives Present study aim see effectiveness mirror therapy Motor Relearning Programme improve hand function stroke . Materials Methods Present study experimental study conduct 12 stroke patient use convenient sample method .Subjects divide two equal group ( n=6 ) . Group A give conventional physiotherapy Motor Relearning Programme exercise affected hand Group B receive conventional physiotherapy affect hand mirror therapy unaffected hand . Chedoke arm hand inventory ( CAHAI ) use primary outcome measure evaluation hand function application therapeutic Intervention
